alert.note: Alert for Tehama (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 2:04PM PDT until March 15 at 11:36PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Sacramento River Near Hamilton City affecting Glenn and Butte Counties. Sacramento River Below Red Bluff Diversion Dam affecting Tehama County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in California... Sacramento River At Ord Ferry affecting Glenn and Butte Counties. Sacramento River At Vina Woodson Bridge affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River At Tehama Bridge affecting Tehama County. .Heavy rainfall from the past 24 hours continues to produce significant rises on the Upper Sacramento river system. Flood wave has reached Vina Woodson Bridge on the Sacramento River and will continue to move downstream. For the Upper Sacramento River...including Bend Bridge, Tehama Bridge, Vina Woodson Bridge, Hamilton City, Ord Ferry, Butte City, Moulton Weir, Colusa Weir, Colusa Bridge, Tisdale Weir...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Sacramento River below Red Bluff Diversion Dam. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 248.6 feet, The river starts to flow eastward into sand slough on the left bank upstream of the gage. At 256.6 feet, Overflow of east bank of river downstream of gage begins. Housing development in the area is threatened. At 256.9 feet, The trailer house at the south end of Idle Wheels Trailer Park starts to take water. Water is up to the parking lot at city park. Paynes Creek slough closes Bell Mill Road at Kaer Avenue. At 257.6 feet, Water starts into the houses on Mary Lane, Howell Street and surrounding streets. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 257.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM PDT Wednesday was 258.9 feet. - Forecast...Forecast to fall below monitor stage of 252.5 FT this afternoon then forecast to recede to near 247.0 FT tomorrow morning then forecast to fluctuate near 247.0 FT into late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 255.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 257.1 feet on 12/31/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. For more hydrologic information and stage definitions refer to the following web site: wrh.noaa.gov/sto/hydro_data.php The next statement will be issued this evening at 1145 PM PDT.
